definition: band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise
(separated only by) a narrow strip of water

sentences.english: "Neighbors separated only by a strip of water." This expression has been employed for a long time to describe the diplomatic communication and the friendship between China and Japan.
sentences.chinese: 一衣带水一直被用来形容中日两国之间的邦交与友谊。

sentences.english: Japan and china are close neighbours separated by only a strip of water.
sentences.chinese: 中日两国一衣带水，隋唐以前，两国已有文化交往。

sentences.english: I lost some weight recently, my clothes are much larger.
sentences.chinese: 我最近减肥，衣带都宽了好多。

sentences.english: They veiled their faces, unbound their garments, and , picking up stones, cast them behind them.
sentences.chinese: 他俩蒙住颜面，松开衣带，捡起石头朝身后扔去。

sentences.english: China and Japan are close neighbours separated only by a strip of water.
sentences.chinese: 中国和日本是一衣带水的近邻。

sentences.english: As the neighbors connected by waters, both countries have witnessed a long history of friendly exchanges.
sentences.chinese: 作为一衣带水的邻国，两国友好交往历史悠久。

sentences.english: My end is no regrets, the Iraqi people to wave.
sentences.chinese: 衣带渐宽终不悔，为伊消得人干瘪。

sentences.english: Who will win a war between Vietnam and China?
sentences.chinese: 中国和越南是一衣带水的亚洲邻邦。

sentences.english: China and Japan are close neighbors facing each other across a narrow strip of water.
sentences.chinese: 中日两国是一衣带水的邻邦。

sentences.english: Shi Liren thin line, the river Yidai long.
sentences.chinese: 石立人行瘦，河流衣带长。

definition: the front piece(s) of a Chinese jacket/lapel
fine black hair/dried plum (sliced, as cake ingredient)
waistband of a skirt/(fig.) related to the wife or another female family member
